entries.title: Peru anti-government protesters clash with police in Puno
entries.description: Protesters demand resignation of President Dina Boluarte, who took office after the removal of Pedro Castillo.

entries.title: Are the presidents of Turkey and Syria about to meet?
entries.description: Turkey's Erdogan has been a vocal critic of Bashar al-Assad, but a reconciliation appears to be under way.

entries.title: Two bodies found in undercarriage of plane at Colombia airport
entries.description: Authorities say they are investigating the nationality and origin of the bodies of two men discovered at Bogota airport.

entries.title: Thousands march in Paris to protest unresolved killings of Kurds
entries.description: Thousands gather in French capital to demand justice for three Kurdish activists who were killed 10 years ago.

entries.title: McCarthy becomes US House speaker, but with diminished power
entries.description: The 57-year-old Republican’s elevation comes after making concessions to an ultraconservative bloc of the party.

entries.title: Pakistan’s army chief visits Saudi Arabia amid economic crisis
entries.description: General Asif Munir travels to Saudi Arabia and UAE as the country faces a crippling economic crisis.

entries.title: Ukraine, Russia exchange fire as Christmas truce falters
entries.description: Rival sides accuse each other of breaching the ceasefire announced by Russia to mark Orthodox Christmas.

entries.title: Deschamps extends contract as France head coach until 2026
entries.description: Didier Deschamps agrees to remain in the role for three-and-a-half more years, ending speculation about his future.

entries.title: Billionaire Jack Ma to cede control of China’s Ant Group
entries.description: Business magnate Jack Ma who controlled over 50 percent of the fintech giant's shares will now hold just 6.2 percent.

entries.title: China suspends social media accounts of COVID policy critics
entries.description: China has suspended or closed hundreds of social media accounts critical of the government’s COVID-19 policies.

entries.title: Five dead after boat carrying migrants sinks off Tunisia’s coast
entries.description: An overcrowded boat carrying migrants attempting to cross the Mediterranean has capsized off the coast of Sfax.

entries.title: What’s next for global real estate in the year ahead?
entries.description: As rate rises hit borrowers, we ask if the global housing market is heading for a painful downturn.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine: The Media Front Line
entries.description: A compilation of Listening Post reports on the media dimensions of the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

entries.title: Albin Kurti: Can Kosovo bond with its ethnic Serbs?
entries.description: Kosovo’s prime minister discusses the latest ethnic tensions.

entries.title: Iran executes two more men in cases linked to ongoing protests
entries.description: Two men hanged after being convicted of killing member of the paramilitary Basij force during continuing protests.

entries.title: Business Critical: Can Companies Inspire A Sustainable Future?
entries.description: earthrise meets the business leaders disrupting the global economic system by prioritising planet as much as profit.

entries.title: Myanmar’s military holds election talks with armed ethic groups
entries.description: The Shan State Progress Party, United Wa State Party and National Democratic Alliance Army attend elections talks.

entries.title: Once in 50,000-year comet to be visible from Earth
entries.description: The comet is made of ice and dust and emits a greenish aura, and is estimated to have a diameter of about a kilometre.

entries.title: Farha and the story of the Palestinian collaborator
entries.description: Collaborators are a traumatising aspect of the Palestinian reality, but they cannot be blamed for Israeli crimes.

entries.title: Brazilian Amazon deforestation up 150% in Bolsonaro’s last month
entries.description: Satellite monitoring detected 218.4 square km of forest cover destroyed in Brazil's share of the Amazon.

entries.title: Republican Kevin McCarthy elected US House speaker
entries.description: The California lawmaker narrowly overcomes opposition from right-wing legislators to secure the speaker's gavel.

entries.title: Decades-old NASA satellite due to re-enter atmosphere, low threat
entries.description: Most of the 2,450kg (5,400lb) satellite will burn up in atmosphere but some pieces are expected to survive re-entry.

entries.title: Teacher shot by 6-year-old with gun in US classroom: Police
entries.description: Police said the shooting was not an accident; investigators are working to determine where the child got the weapon.

entries.title: Artillery shells fly on Ukraine’s front lines despite ‘ceasefire’
entries.description: Exchanges of artillery fire were reported along the front lines in Ukraine’s Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

entries.title: Australia’s battered tourism puts hope in China’s reopening
entries.description: Tourism-reliant businesses are hopeful the return of Chinese visitors will revive the sector from the pandemic slump.

entries.title: Mali’s military leader Goita pardons 49 Ivory Coast soldiers
entries.description: The mass pardoning comes one week after Mali sentenced 46 of the jailed Ivorian soldiers to 20 years in prison.

entries.title: Italian man pleads guilty to book fraud scheme in US court
entries.description: Filippo Bernardini allegedly targetted top authors like Margaret Atwood, as well as up-and-coming talent in publishing.

entries.title: Florida activates national guard as Cuban arrivals seek refuge
entries.description: Governor Ron DeSantis criticised US President Joe Biden's immigration stance as rising numbers of Cuban refugees arrive.
